Melrose, Massachusetts 
                                     August 24, 1904 

Dear Sister Marian Davis: 


     Let not one anxious thought come into your mind. I am sorry you are so ill, but do everything you can on your part for the recovery of your health. I will see that all bills of expense shall be settled. I am not well; not able to travel but 
                                                                           252
a little distance in the carriage. I dare not commit myself to the lengthy journeys on the cars. As long as I and you shall live, my home is your home. . . .
